p: Population stratification may bias GWAS through two routes: the choice of the cohort and association analysis. Currently, individuals are matched and grouped mainly using self-reported “race” rather than genomic ancestry. This criterion is believed to account for the participants’ genetic background and supposedly allow controlling for population genetic structure (e.g., [ 53, 54]). A numerical example of how a false positive association can be created due to population stratification is demonstrated by Hellwege et al. [ 55].
